treatment.taxon_hierarchy: family Asteraceae;tribe Anthemideae;genus Artemisia;species laciniata;subspecies laciniata;
treatment.description: Stems 20–50 cm, hairy. Leaves mostly cauline, blades 5–20 × 1–2 cm, sparsely hairy. Heads in arrays 8–18 × 1–4 cm. Involucres 3–5 × 4–8 mm. Corollas yellowish, 1–1.5 mm. Cypselae 0.5–1 mm. 2n = 18.

habitat_info.text: dry , gravelly stream banks , grassy flats , forested areas , dry hillsides ;

treatment.discussion: Widely distributed in Eurasia and often confused with Artemisia norvegica, A. laciniata subsp. laciniata can be distinguished by its well-developed basal leaves and smaller heads.
